div.p: CCCC MS 78 contains a fifteenth century copy of De uiris claris, the fifth book of Domenico di Bandino's (d. 1413) Fons memorabilium uniuersi. The Fons memorabilium is an encyclopaedia derived from a large number of classical and medieval sources and De uiris claris is dedicated to the study of man both as a biological entity and more generally, featuring a number of biographies of medieval and early renaissance figures. A letter written in Florence survives as part of the binding, suggesting that the book is of Italian origin, but how and when it came to Parker is uncertain.
